channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Teachers and supporters gather in Alberta education minister's riding as back-to-work legislation looms
item.description: Protesters gathered in Alberta Education Minister Demetrios Nicolaides' riding of Calgary-Bow, calling on the the government to increase its support of public education ahead of back-to-work legislation for striking teachers.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Field of Crosses welcoming students despite Alberta teacher strike
item.description: Field of Crosses and Valour Canada are working to ensure Alberta students can learn about the sacrifices made by members of the Canadian military from Southern Alberta.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ottawa is pledging more on defence — and Calgary wants a piece of the action
item.description: While Calgary is best known as an oil and gas town, a growing aerospace and defence industry has largely flown under the radar. The sector hopes to get a boost from a renewed national interest in defence spending, and in sourcing contracts from Canadian companies.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Carney in Asia to promote Canada as reliable trade partner amid tensions with U.S.
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney is promoting Canada as a reliable trade partner at the ASEAN summit after U.S. President Donald Trump halted trade talks over an Ontario ad.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: They survived one of Canada's first high school shootings. Here's what happened next
item.description: Fifty years ago on Monday, a horrific murder followed by a fatal school shooting shook Ottawa to its core. In the leadup to the anniversary, survivors of the school shooting are speaking out about the event's impact in the days and decades that followed.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Carney claims feds have ‘sole responsibility' for U.S. talks
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has threatened a new tariff against Canada, as Prime Minister Mark Carney says his country "respects trade agreements."
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Striking B.C. public service workers announce tentative deal with province
item.description: The B.C. General Employees' Union (BCGEU) has reached a tentative deal with the province, which could bring an end to a weeks-long strike that has impacted everything from liquor distribution to wildfire fighting.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canadians ditch once-popular Trump Halloween costumes this year amid trade war
item.description: Demand for Trump Halloween costumes was high when the U.S. president was first campaigning against Democrat Hillary Clinton in 2016, Canadian costume shop owners say, but it has since fallen in recent years.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Despite Trump's anger, Canadian politicians won't say Ontario's anti-tariff ad was a mistake
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Alberta premier responds to threat of broader labour action in call-in radio show
item.description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith says legislation to force striking teachers back to work may come Monday, as tensions rise over possible use of the notwithstanding clause.

item.title: Alberta Civic Election Hot Take: UCP’s Scheme Flops
item.description: The Smith government’s law encouraging big corporate donations largely failed to elect friendlier city councils.

item.title: Trump announces 10 per cent tariff increase on Canadian goods
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump announced a 10 per cent tariff increase on Canadian goods in a post on Truth Social Saturday afternoon after a controversial ad campaign.

item.title: Newfoundland's Between Breaths makes Western Canadian debut at the Firehall

item.title: A Lot of Influencers Talk about the News. Not All of Them Are Journalists
item.description: Platforms like TikTok are flooded with content creators gabbing about current events. It’s time for journalists to join the fray.

item.title: Search resumes for missing plane flying from Happy Valley-Goose Bay to Greenland
item.description: Naviair, a state-owned company providing air traffic service, says the plane was flying from Happy Valley-Goose Bay to Greenland when it went missing.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: 'I hope they win it': Nova Scotian who pitched for Blue Jays reflects on playoff run, his career
item.description: Vince Horsman, who was born and raised in Dartmouth, N.S., played in 141 games over five seasons in the majors leagues, including one season with the Toronto Blue Jays in 1991. Watching the team on their current playoff run, Horsman says they remind him of a style of baseball from another era.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: ‘Right now, we don’t have the votes’ to pass federal budget, says Liberal House leader
item.description: Liberal House leader Steven MacKinnon says the government does not have enough votes at the moment to pass the upcoming federal budget — and he’s pressing opposition parties to consider whether they want another election.

item.title: Suki’s: Fifty-four years of style, education, and legacy
item.description: For 54 years, Suki’s has shaped Vancouver’s hair culture through artistry and education. Named Best Salon in the Georgia Straight’s Best of Vancouver 2025, the iconic brand continues to set the standard for innovation, collaboration, and timeless style—from its world-class Academy to its visionary team.
